result.execSummary:
The defendant Traevon L Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision if revoked, this can be based on a budget plan.
If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Obtain high school diploma.
Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

No contact with the victim as specified in the criminal complaint.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: The first 10 DAYS are to be served straight time. The remaining condition time is stayed and is to be used at the probation agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Traevon L Patterson

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript (36 pages) commencing JULY 29, 2015 received and filed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per request of court reporter.
Bail Refund Packets
8/7/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.  at

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Janice L. and Linda P.

As to Count 1 as amended:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 2 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program andthe WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision:
-6 months of condition time.  The first 10 DAYS are to be served straight time. The remaining condition time is stayed and is to be used at the probation agent's discretion. 
- No contact with the victim as specified in the criminal complaint.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
-Complete 120 hours of community services (40 hours per year).
-Obtain high school diploma.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision if revoked, this can be based on a budget plan.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Traevon L Patterson in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing.  
As to Count 1 as amended: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed (positive drug test).
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Status Report from Milw. County Behavioral Health Division

Defendant Traevon L Patterson in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defense attorney Morales is withdrawn from the case due to a personal leave.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 22. Status conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Traevon L Patterson in court with attorney Christian Eichenlaub for Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Charge has been amended in the information to Attempt Robery (Threat of Force), purusant to WI Statutes 943.32(1)(b), 939.50(3)(e) and 939.32, a class E felony.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Traevon L Patterson in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Ronald Dague for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Tabatha Kurzynski-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State requests an Arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Arraignment scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/30/15.

04/28/2015

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Tiffany CT or her family
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Traevon L Patterson in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Traevon L Patterson in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner Orders the Sheriff Department to collect DNA from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

At the request of the ADA and No objection from the Defense Attorney, Preliminary Hearing set prior to the 6th Business Day.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
